rComments: Even though she seems like a very nice lady, I don't like her teaching methods. Her lectures are filled with a lot of rhetoric and aren't very well structured. She wastes a lot of class time by making us talk amongst our neighbors to answer a question. The tests are horribly written, and not always related to lecture material. This class was a req.

While Susan Curtis genuinely enjoys teaching and can be quite entertaining, she lacks the ability to adequately structure a class. The classes consist of sitting there and completing frustrating worksheets that correspond to subjects she has explained only minimally. In addition, the test questions are ambiguous, and the point system is baffling.

i really liked prof curtis.  i struggled sometimes because she gave us too much time in class to work on these worksheets that we didn't know how to do, when she could have been teaching it to us.  however, whenever i asked her a question she was very helpful.  i also liked her laid back style.  her kids were nuts, though.

I don't think that Professor Curtis taught me anything this semester. The lectures have consisted of her giving us worksheets covering material that we have not learned yet. We never actually talk about the material that is on our weekly quiz. If you have had accounting in high school you will do fine, otherwise this is not a fun class.

she is good to students. just bear with her kid in the class. and she sometimes had tricky questions, but it is easy if u know the way she tricked u. unfortunately i am not able to figure it out. anyway. i just hope higher accy classes wont let me down like that.
Can't write a test.

I understand the material, read all the online and textbook readings, but still cannot manage to score much higher than average on her exams (which is usually a 70%). She phrases the questions in a way to screw you over and does not give you a chance to prove your knowledge. I feel this defeats the purpose of an exam.
does not teach in lecture. expects students to know everything and definitions that are given are poorly worded. dont know why she even has a lecture.
Terrible at making tests

After going through Prof. Curtis and Prof. Finnegan, I would have believed it if somebody said UIUC's Accounting Program was ranked third or second to the last. The Accy Department must be full of senseless people to let poor teaching like this go on for semesters.

Yes her exams are tricky and yes her lectures can be about pretty useless stuff. But overall, shes a good teacher. She grades fairly, she does what she needs to do. The book is not useless because its what she tests us on. Theres nothing really to complain. Joining this course esp without prior knowledge on Accy means ALOT of outside reading to do.

Susan Curtis is a great teacher, despite the fact that singing and dancing occur in lecture.  She is very nice and willing to help if you go to her.  The class seems disorganized at first, but by the end of the semester, everything seems to come together... You need to be open to her teaching style and you will learn a lot.

Absolutely atrocious. Lectures are just two hour rants about things that are never tested. Tests full of trick questions which undermine any actual learning. Bad communication with students, never gave out final exam grades. NOTE: Composes a supplementary text book and sells it, but it is NEVER used for any test or homework questions. Fraud??

She has no business being a teacher. Never says anything worth anything. If you try to learn the stuff, you will be screwed because all she talks about is how she tries to trick you (which is absolutely true). Memorize the problem sets and learn the ways she tries to trick you. Go to class for extra credit and don't miss discussions.

Curtis is awesome. She teaches a lot of important things for upper level classes in both accounting and finance. She also does a good job of giving good grades to kids who understand the subject. A lot of the comments on this page are unfounded and probably written by bitter insecure  children with entitlement issues. Probably from the N burbs

Tips for future students: (1) Don't buy the book w/ the readings. Never used once. (2) Come to lec for the E/C, Come to disc for the answers for online hw. (3) You WILL get an A on tests if you memorize the practice sets. (4) Yes, the remainder of the lectures in the semester will probably focus on life lessons re: "professionalism". Bring a pillow

By far my least favorite professor at U of I. The entire class is a theatrical spectacle. She actually majored in the arts in college, which explains the abundant singing and dancing acts she puts on in class. Go to class for extra credit. The only useful material is learned after the first midterm. She is disorganized and does not return emails.

Quite possibly the worst teacher I have ever had. Lectures are pointless, usually an average of 10 minutes of useful information out of an hour and half lecture. Extremely unorganized teacher, seems like she is just making it up as she goes along. Swears in class to try and "connect" with students, tasteless. Lots of EC, needed.

Yeah Curtis is a terrible lecturer.  It's only worth going to class because of the extra credit.  About 10% of what she says in an hour and a half lecture is important.  The class is poorly organized as there's terrible communication between Curtis, the TA's, and students.
She's a nice lady, but I agree with the person who said it was The Susan Curtis show.  Not a very good lecturer.  This class just seemed pointless.  I'm looking forward to Accy 202.
